intro: Pavetta suurbergensis, commonly known as the Suurberg pavetta, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky areas and is adapted to dry conditions. Pavetta suurbergensis is often found in the Western and Eastern Cape provinces of South Africa.
